review: I love this things.I only used it for a couple days with my android tablet casting You Tube on the TV. It took me less than 4 minutes from opening the package to having You Tube on the screen. No more laptop with a long HDMI cable anymore. I am wireless.I have not try to cast other things yet. I hope casting home movie is also as easy.P.S. my TV does not have an USB port. I am glad that google includes a long usb cord and a USB/AC power adapter.
author: H. H. Do "keep on smiling"

review: I got this for a bunch of family members for Christmas.  I didnt get one for myself because I have a "smart" tv.  After seeing everyone else's in action I got one for my bedroom tv.  After seeing it on my bedroom tv, I put it on my main "smart" tv.  It is faster, less glitchy, and buffers less frequently than the apps on my smart tv.  The user interface is much simpler.  I turned off the internet to my tv and use the chromecast exclusively.Its easy to set-up.  All you really need to know is your wifi network's name and your pass code for your network.  But you must have wifi.Netflix, Youtube, and HBOGo work nearly flawlessly from iPhone, iPad and similar devices. Amazon's instant video app is currently not compatible.  And I havent tried hulu, crackle and a few others.To cast a  video or other resource from a website that doesnt have a compatible app requires a laptop however.

review: This tiny piece of equipment has given me such fun!  I plugged it into my TV, downloaded the Chromecast program to my Galaxy S4 phone (also my tablet) and voila!! I also have Pandora on my phone and some days I use Chromecast to play background music over my TV speakers all day.  I really LIKE this little guy!!
